channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A Stained Glass Christmas, from Chartres to Baltimore’s Gilded Age
item.description: ‘Like painting in air’ with colored light, John La Farge said of his church glass art.

item.title: James Talarico says the biggest ‘welfare queens’ in America are ‘the giant corporations that don’t pay a penny in income taxes’
item.description: The 2026 Senate hopeful says major corporations cost taxpayers far more than social safety net programs.

item.title: Democrats reveal whether Walz should testify and be held accountable for massive fraud under his watch
item.description: Some Democrats signal a desire to see Tim Walz testify to Congress about what happened in his state with Medicaid fraud, as the case appeared to be ev...

item.title: Trump’s Venezuela oil blockade puts Chevron in the middle of a high-stakes sanctions crackdown
item.description: Chevron, the lone U.S. company in the South American country, has weathered years of political and economic instability in Venezuela, but the latest U...

item.title: China’s Alarming Latin America Strategy
item.description: A new paper reveals the essence of Beijing’s worldview: the entire world is one chessboard, and the Taiwan question is at its center.

item.title: Natasha Lyonne says AI has an ethics problem because right now it’s ‘super kosher copacetic to rob freely under the auspices of acceleration’
item.description: Lyonne’s production company developed a tool for generating big screen-ready AI content.

item.title: Trump Has No Authority to Categorize Fentanyl as a Weapon of Mass Destruction
item.description: Common sense tells us that narcotic drugs are different from WMD. As one would expect, these differences are reflected in law.

item.title: Sen Murphy warns 'people are going to die' as Congress punts on expiring Obamacare subsidies
item.description: Lawmakers blame each other for looming Obamacare subsidy expiration as Sen. Chris Murphy, D-Conn., warns premium spikes will have life-or-death conseq...

item.title: ’Tis the Season for Trimming Travel Regulations
item.description: The best gift to fliers this holiday season would be to let the competitive airline marketplace do its thing.

item.title: Tesla’s chief designer accidentally smashed a $61K Cybertruck’s ‘armor glass’ window with a metal ball. Now he says it was a ‘great marketing moment’
item.description: CEO Elon Musk claimed more than 200,000 orders for the vehicle following its botched reveal in 2019.

item.title: Dem Senate candidate faces backlash after violent fantasy against conservative SCOTUS justices goes viral
item.description: Michigan Democratic Senate candidate Mallory McMorrow is facing backlash after a clip went viral revealing violent fantasy if she saw Brett Kavanaugh ...

item.title: Strengthening the Military Chaplain Corps Is a Win for Religious Liberty
item.description: A government institution charged with defending the Constitution shouldn’t marginalize religion itself. At long last, it won’t.

item.title: Gen Z is open minded about blue-collar work and the Fords of the economy need them — but both sides are missing each other
item.description: Clinton Crawford, an automotive technician, said college was pushed on his kids. “That’s good, if that’s for you, but I don’t think it’s for everyone....

item.title: ‘They’ll lose their humanity’: Dartmouth professor says he’s surprised just how scared his Gen Z students are of AI
item.description: A lot of Scott Anthony's students are excited to use AI, he told Fortune, but a meaningful portion are "scared full stop." They have "hesitation and f...

item.title: 'Too many redactions': Lawmakers say Epstein file release does not meet their requirements
item.description: Lawmakers said the Justice Department's release Friday of a limited and heavily redacted portion of its case files on Jeffrey Epstein violates the law...

item.title: Chaplains Punished For Mentioning Jesus Cheer Hegseth’s Return To God-Focused Ministry
item.description: The chaplain brings God to the fight, offering something bigger for the soldier to hold on to. It is something an atheist can't offer.

item.title: Wyoming GOP Sen. Lummis will not run for reelection
item.description: Sen. Cynthia Lummis, Wyoming Republican, announced Friday that she will not run for reelection in 2026, citing a "change of heart."

item.title: Yes, Trump Pardoned 70-Year-Old Colorado Election Clerk, Gov. Polis Should Too
item.description: As Christians celebrate the birth of Jesus, Tina Peters' supporters call on Gov. Polis to reflect that spirit.

item.title: Rep. Elise Stefanik drops out of New York's governor race, no reelection bid for House
item.description: Rep. Elise Stefanik has suspended her campaign for New York governorand said she will not be seeking reelection for her House seat, either.
